title: Noah Consulting being acquired by Infosys in $70 mn deal
text:
Noah Consulting being acquired by Infosys in $70 mn deal 
Technology Industry News.Net : Monday 19th October, 2015 
BANGALORE, India - Tech major Infosys Monday announced the acquisition of America-based Noah Consulting, valuing the firm that provides information management consulting services for the oil and gas industry at $70 million. 
Subject to customary closing conditions, the all-cash deal, which follows a definitive agreement between the Houston-headquartered and the Bangalore-based companies, is expected to close before the end of the third quarter of 2015-16 fiscal year, Infosys said in a statement. 
Rajesh Murthy, executive vice president and global head of energy, communications and services of Infosys said the acquisition "combines Noah's deep industry knowledge, information strategy planning, data governance and architecture capabilities with Infosys' ability to provide technology and outsourcing services on a global scale to oil and gas clients". 
"With this acquisition, we are uniquely positioned to offer end-to-end data management services to oil and gas companies globally," Murthy said. 
Noah Consulting is the Infosys's third acquisition this year after it bought US-based digital experience provider Kallidus for $120 million and US-based automation technology company Panaya for $200 million with a valuation that was six times the multiple of its revenues. 
Founded in 2008, Noah Consulting helps upstream oil and gas companies, independents and oil field service companies plan, architect and deploy information solutions to unlock the value of their oil and gas assets. 
"Our oil and gas clients are adjusting to a new normal of lower oil prices. There is an urgency to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their operations in a safe and reliable manner. This acquisition is part of Infosys' strategy to bring next generation data analytics solutions to the oil and gas industry," said Sanjay Purohit, EVP and global head of Infosys Consulting. 
John Ruddy, president of Noah Consulting said that his company was "excited about the new capabilities that the combination of Noah and Infosys will bring to our clients". 
"We can effect transformational change for our oil and gas clients by using information management to integrate supply chain, safety, environmental and financial data with geo-science, engineering and other operational and technical data an industry challenge that has never been addressed effectively." 
Infosys provides consulting, technology, outsourcing and next-generation services. Its shares traded 1.5 percent higher at Rs 1,111, outperforming the broader Sensex, which traded with 0.2 percent gains.
